JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Guido Raimondi;Helen Keller;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , at TIME , the applicant ’s brother , PERSON , died as a result of falling from the roof of a building , allegedly while trying to pick a fig from a tree .
CARDINAL . Following the incident gendarmerie officers arrived at the scene of the incident . They drafted a report at TIME and drew a sketch .
CARDINAL . ORG began an investigation into the incident .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a formal complaint with ORG .

CARDINAL . According to the autopsy report of CARDINAL DATE , the experts observed several abrasions and ecchymoses on the deceased ’s body . They concluded that the cause of death was fractures to his head due to blunt head trauma , and cerebral bleeding .
CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor inspected the scene of the incident and interviewed CARDINAL suspects .
CARDINAL . In the meantime the gendarmerie questioned several witnesses .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision not to prosecute . The prosecutor found that PERSON had died as a result of falling from the roof of a building while trying to pick a fig .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an objection against the decision not to prosecute .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE and ordered that criminal proceedings be initiated against the suspects on account of the findings of the autopsy report of CARDINAL DATE . Drawing attention to the ecchymoses on PERSON ’s body , the assize court noted that those wounds might have occurred during a fight .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a bill of indictment charging CARDINAL persons with intentional homicide under LAW of the former LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE , at the fifth hearing , ORG acquitted the accused as there was not sufficient evidence to convict them .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment .
CARDINAL . Following the acquittal of the accused , on CARDINAL DATE ORG issued an extended search warrant in connection with the search for the perpetrators of the incident , valid until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant made a request to ORG for the investigation to be reopened as he was not satisfied with the outcome of the criminal proceedings . He expressed doubts about the way his brother had died .

CARDINAL . On DATE a gendarmerie officer took a statement from the applicant concerning the incident . He stated that his brother must have been murdered . The applicant requested that statements be taken from certain persons about whom he had suspicions .
CARDINAL . After the issue of the search warrant , the gendarmerie reported to ORG at regular intervals that they had been unable to find the perpetrators of the killing of PERSON
